org.apromore.plugin.impl

Class DefaultPropertyAwarePlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apromore.plugin.impl.DefaultPlugin
      • org.apromore.plugin.impl.DefaultPropertyAwarePlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Plugin, PropertyAwarePlugin

    public abstract class DefaultPropertyAwarePlugin
extends DefaultPlugin
implements PropertyAwarePlugin
    Default implementation of an Apromore Plugin that allows for runtime parameters. If your Plugin should be configurable by the User at runtime, then you should inherit this class and register your parameters using registerProperty(PluginPropertyType) in the Constructor.
    Author:
    Felix Mannhardt (Bonn-Rhein-Sieg University oAS)

      Creates a DefaultPropertyAwarePlugin

      Returns the Set of all optional properties for this Plugin.

      • getOptionalProperties

        public Set<PropertyType<?>> getOptionalProperties()
        Description copied from interface: PropertyAwarePlugin
        Returns the Set of all optional properties for this Plugin. That should be the result of PropertyAwarePlugin.getAvailableProperties() minus the result of PropertyAwarePlugin.getMandatoryProperties().
        Specified by:
        getOptionalProperties in interface PropertyAwarePlugin
        Returns:
        Set of PropertyType that are optional

      • getAvailableProperties

        public Set<PropertyType<?>> getAvailableProperties()
        Description copied from interface: PropertyAwarePlugin
        Returns the Set of all available properties for this Plugin.
        Specified by:
        getAvailableProperties in interface PropertyAwarePlugin
        Returns:
        Set of PropertyType that contains both mandatory and optional properties.

      • registerProperty

        protected boolean registerProperty(PluginPropertyType<?> property)
        Adds a property to the list of available properties.
        Parameters:
        property - to be added
        Returns:
        true if property was added, false if property was already available or NULL
